# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is a concise implementation of `wrap_string` in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, strip(current_line))
            current_line = word * " "
        else
            current_line *= word * " "
        end
    end
    
    push!(lines, strip(current_line))  # Add the last line
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
text = "This is a simple test string to demonstrate the wrapping functionality."
println(wrap_string(text, 15))
```

Output:

```
This is a
simple test
string to
demonstrate
the wrapping
functionality.
```
